subject: Law
title: The National Environmental Policy Act
description: One-minute skill: The National Environmental Policy Act.

hook.text: A highway project would destroy a wetland. NEPA says the government must study that impact before building.

buildup.text: NEPA (1970) requires federal agencies to assess environmental impacts before taking major actions.

discovery.text: The key tool is the Environmental Impact Statementâ€”a detailed analysis of proposed actions and alternatives.

twist.text: NEPA doesn't require the government to choose the greenest option. It only requires studying the consequences.

climax.text: It's been used to delay pipelines, highways, and dams. Critics say it slows progress; defenders say it prevents harm.

punchline.text: Look before you build. That's NEPA's simple but powerful rule.

quiz.question: What does NEPA require from federal agencies?
options: Assessing environmental impacts before major actions
